interviews.description: Interviewer presents a client problem and guides the candidate through data, exhibits and focused questions. Expect hypothesis-driven probing and frequent data tables.
interviews.examplePrompts: "A client's retail margins are slipping — how would you diagnose the cause?" "Here's a slide with sales & costs — what stands out? What do you want to test next?"
interviews.evaluation: Structured problem solving, hypothesis-driven thinking, mental math, ability to interpret exhibits quickly and prioritize analyses.
interviews.keyFocus: Hypothesis-driven thinking, mental math, data interpretation
interviews.tip: State a clear hypothesis early, build a short issue tree, verbalize assumptions, walk through arithmetic aloud.

interviews.format: One deep behavioral story (10–15 min) with many follow-ups
interviews.description: McKinsey drills one episode to assess core traits rather than many anecdotes.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Tell me about a time you led a team through a difficult situation." Follow-ups: "What specifically did you do? Why that choice? What were the measurable results?"
interviews.evaluation: Leadership, personal impact, initiative, collaboration, self-awareness and ability to quantify impact.
interviews.tip: Prepare 3–4 STAR stories focused on your actions with measurable outcomes; rehearse many follow-ups.

interviews.format: Timed web assessment or PST (26 Q MCQ)
interviews.description: Screening tests: historically the PST and more recently McKinsey's digital Solve assessment — both test problem-solving under time pressure through data interpretation and simulation exercises.
interviews.examplePrompts: PST example: short passages + tables with MCQs like "Which conclusion is supported by the data?" Solve: simulation exercises and case-style tasks in a timed web assessment.
interviews.evaluation: Speedy data-interpretation, quantitative reasoning, deductive logic under time pressure.
interviews.tip: Practice official McKinsey PST PDFs or Solve practice; timeboxed drills and data-sufficiency training.

interviews.format: Candidate structures and leads the analysis
interviews.description: Candidate structures and leads the analysis (you drive the issues / frameworks). BCG provides prep materials and practice cases.
interviews.examplePrompts: "A client in X industry is losing market share — how would you approach?" Expect open problem statements and interviewer prompts to probe your structure and insights.
interviews.evaluation: Structure & creativity of problem decomposition, commercial judgment, math, and clear communication.
interviews.tip: Lead with a framework/issue tree, explain your priority hypotheses, and present concise recommendations.

interviews.format: Behavioral questions often mixed into case
interviews.description: Behavioral questions to assess leadership, teamwork, and personal fit. Often mixed into a case interview.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Tell me about a time you persuaded peers to accept your idea." Follow-ups on trade-offs, obstacles, and outcomes.
interviews.evaluation: Cultural fit, collaboration, influence, and drive.
interviews.tip: Use STAR with concrete metrics; show impact and working style.

interviews.description: Bain emphasizes commercial clarity and actionable recommendations; candidate leads the case. Bain provides official prep resources and practice cases.
interviews.examplePrompts: "How should a retailer decide whether to enter an online channel?" "What are the main levers to improve this client's margin?"
interviews.evaluation: Practical commercial instincts, synthesis, ability to recommend clear, implementable actions.
interviews.tip: Focus on recommendations and implementation – close with a clear, prioritized action plan.

interviews.description: Behavioral discussion of past work and impact, tied to Bain's operating principles.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Walk me through a project you're proud of and the specific role you played."
interviews.evaluation: Personal impact, teamwork, client presence, and cultural fit.
interviews.tip: Prepare examples showing both problem solving and client-facing behavior.

interviews.description: Individual case interviews for strategy roles; format mixes candidate-led and interviewer-led depending on the team.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Analyze this market-entry scenario" or "How would you help a client cut costs by 10%?"
interviews.evaluation: Structured analysis, communication, ability to tailor solutions to client context.
interviews.tip: Clarify scope early, tie recommendations to implementation practicality.

interviews.description: Many Deloitte processes include group cases and assessment-center style exercises, especially for campus hires.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Your team has 60 minutes to analyze the problem and present recommendations."
interviews.evaluation: Teamwork, facilitation, ability to synthesize group inputs, persuasion.
interviews.tip: Speak early, structure the team's approach, and ensure you both lead and listen.

interviews.description: Strategy& blends traditional consulting case formats with PwC structure; expect candidate-led cases plus behavioral questions.
interviews.examplePrompts: "A manufacturer wants to enter country X — size the market and design an entry plan."
interviews.evaluation: Structured problem solving, commercial thinking, presentation skills.
interviews.tip: Practice both case breakdowns and written/group presentation exercises.

interviews.description: Many recruiting tracks include written cases or group exercises where you prepare a short presentation.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Analyze the slide pack and deliver a 5-minute recommendation with 3 supporting points."
interviews.tip: Practice succinct slide decks and presenting with clarity under time pressure.

interviews.description: Standard behavioral interviews targeted at leadership, client service and consulting drive.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Describe a time you managed conflict on a team project."
interviews.tip: Have STAR examples with quantifiable results tied to client outcomes.

interviews.description: EY-Parthenon focuses on strategy cases divided into 'describe → recommend → defend' flow.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Walk me through how you'd evaluate M&A target X for our client."
interviews.evaluation: Strategic judgment, structuring, ability to defend recommendations under challenge.
interviews.tip: Use the describe-recommend-defend structure; be ready to defend assumptions with quantitative thinking.

interviews.description: Campus and some lateral processes use group cases and written deliverables followed by presentations.
interviews.examplePrompts: "As a team, produce a one-page recommendation in 45 minutes and present it."
interviews.evaluation: Collaboration, ability to synthesize quickly, and presentation polish.
interviews.tip: Lead with a clear recommendation, back it with 2–3 succinct points, and involve teammates.

interviews.description: Behavioral questions probing leadership, impact, and motivation for strategy roles.
interviews.examplePrompts: "Tell me about a time you had to influence senior stakeholders."
interviews.evaluation: Influence, client readiness, maturity of judgment.
interviews.keyFocus: Influence, client readiness, maturity of judgment
interviews.tip: Prepare concrete examples that emphasize persuasion and measurable outcomes.
